story.text: TORONTO Jan 3 The Toronto Stock Exchange's main index closed down more than 200 points on Wednesday following along a steep pullback in commodities and oil prices, which weighed on the broader market. The Toronto Stock Exchange S&P/TSX composite index .GSPTSE unofficially closed down 215.48 points, or 1.7 percent, at 12,708.18. ($1=$1.17 Canadian)
story.title: toronto stocks plunge on weak energy , metals
